items.reason: Kubernetes SIG Architecture API Governance is a core governance topic for the Kubernetes ecosystem and not covered in the current Wiki.

items.title: Running NanoClaw in a Docker Shell Sandbox
items.summary: Ever wanted to run a personal AI assistant that monitors your WhatsApp messages 24/7, but worried about giving it access to your entire system? Docker Sandboxes' new shell sandbox type is the perfect solution. In this post, I'll show you how to run NanoClaw, a lightweight Claude-powered WhatsApp ass
items.reason: Docker’s shell‑sandbox feature for running AI assistants is a novel security‑and‑productivity use‑case that warrants its own article.

items.title: How to solve the context size issues with context packing with Docker Model Runner and Agentic Compose
items.summary: If you’ve worked with local language models, you’ve probably run into the context window limit, especially when using smaller models on less powerful machines. While it’s an unavoidable constraint, techniques like context packing make it surprisingly manageable. Hello, I’m Philippe, and I am a Princ
items.reason: Context‑packing techniques for local LLMs are emerging best‑practice material relevant to developers using Docker Model Runner.

items.title: Hardened Images Are Free. Now What?
items.summary: Docker Hardened Images are now free, covering Alpine, Debian, and over 1,000 images including databases, runtimes, and message buses. For security teams, this changes the economics of container vulnerability management. DHI includes security fixes from Docker’s security team, which simplifies securi
items.reason: Docker Hardened Images becoming free is a significant shift for container security and vulnerability management.

items.title: Reduce Vulnerability Noise with VEX: Wiz + Docker Hardened Images
items.summary: Open source components power most modern applications. A new generation of hardened container images can establish a more secure foundation, but even with hardened images, vulnerability scanners often return dozens or hundreds of CVEs with little prioritization. This noise slows teams down and compl
items.reason: The VEX integration with Docker Hardened Images addresses vulnerability‑noise reduction, a topic not yet documented.

items.title: Get Started with the Atlassian Rovo MCP Server Using Docker
items.summary: We’re excited to announce that the remote Atlassian Rovo MCP server is now available in Docker’s MCP Catalog and Toolkit, making it easier than ever to connect AI assistants to Jira and Confluence. With just a few clicks, technical teams can use their favorite AI agents to create and update Jira iss
items.reason: Running Atlassian Rovo MCP Server in Docker ties AI‑assisted DevOps to containerization, a distinct subject for the Wiki.

items.title: Automate repository tasks with GitHub Agentic Workflows
items.summary:
Discover GitHub Agentic Workflows, now in technical preview. Build automations using coding agents in GitHub Actions to handle triage, documentation, code quality, and more.
The post Automate repository tasks with GitHub Agentic Workflows   appeared first on The GitHub Blog.
items.reason: GitHub Agentic Workflows introduce programmable AI agents in CI/CD pipelines – a high‑impact feature needing coverage.

items.title: Welcome to the Eternal September of open source. Here’s what we plan to do for maintainers.
items.summary:
Open source is hitting an “Eternal September.” As contribution friction drops, maintainers are adapting with new trust signals, triage approaches, and community-led solutions.
The post Welcome to the Eternal September of open source. Here’s what we plan to do for maintainers. appeared first on
items.reason: The “Eternal September” analysis of open‑source maintainer challenges is a strategic discussion relevant to the community.

items.title: GitHub availability report: January 2026
items.summary:
In January, we experienced two incidents that resulted in degraded performance across GitHub services.
The post GitHub availability report: January 2026 appeared first on The GitHub Blog.
items.reason: Monthly availability reports provide operational insight for GitHub users; documenting the January 2026 incident adds historical context.

items.title: Continuous AI in practice: What developers can automate today with agentic CI
items.summary:
Think of Continuous AI as background agents that operate in your repository for tasks that require reasoning.
The post Continuous AI in practice: What developers can automate today with agentic CI appeared first on The GitHub Blog.
items.reason: Continuous AI / agentic CI is an emerging automation paradigm that developers need guidance on.

items.reason: Integration of Claude and Codex into Agent HQ expands the AI‑assistant ecosystem; a dedicated page is warranted.

items.title: oven-sh/bun bun-v1.3.9
items.summary:
To install Bun v1.3.9
```bash
curl -fsSL https://bun.sh/install | bash
# or you can use npm
# npm install -g bun
```

Windows:
```bash
powershell -c "irm bun.sh/install.ps1|iex"
```

To upgrade to Bun v1.3.9:
```bash
bun upgrade
```

### [Read Bun v1.3.9's release notes on Bun's blo
items.reason: Bun v1.3.9 release introduces performance and language updates; developers using Bun need a reference.
